featureSchema.name: Customizable Response Delays
featureSchema.description: Introduces configurable delays and timeouts to simulate real-world network latency or server processing time.
featureSchema.userStory: As a developer, I want to simulate different network conditions, including delays and timeouts, to ensure my client applications can handle slow responses.
featureSchema.acceptanceCriteria: Admins should be able to configure response delays and simulate timeouts, and the mock server must apply these delays accurately.
featureSchema.diagram: Illustration of a timing diagram showing delayed responses and simulated timeouts between client and server.
featureSchema.additional: Support both fixed delays and randomized latency variations.
featureSchema.prompt: Create a feature that allows configuration of response delays and timeouts. It should enable both fixed and random delays to mimic various network conditions.
featureSchema.code:
// Pseudo-code for response delay:
// setTimeout(() => sendResponse(), configuredDelay);
featureSchema.notes: Make sure the delay settings can be overridden for specific endpoints if needed.
